body:
Good morning!

If you run across this post, I want you to do one thing today that is for YOU and makes YOU happy! It is so important to take care of ourselves and if you’re a busy person, a mom, a caring person, and the list goes on…you often forget to take care of yourself! It’s important mentally and spiritually and the benefits of taking care of yourself and providing happiness to yourself will show in other aspects of your life! I often forget and only care for others. I’m going to get my hair done after an entire year and then taking my mom to get a pedicure since she did my taxes for me! Bless her so much! Whatever you do today doesn’t have to be monetary. Sit and watch TV if that’s what you need! Let me know- What are you going to do today?

summary: Help raise £2000 to Support for Khaled; a student with Hodgkins Lymphoma
title: Help raise £2000 to Support for Khaled; a student with Hodgkins Lymphoma
excerpt: Weʼre raising money to Support for Khaled; a student with Hodgkins Lymphoma. Support this JustGiving Crowdfunding Page.
description:
Hi, guys- I know how powerful a force of good tumblr can be, despite its bad reputation. I’ve reblogged many crowdfunding pages during the last six years I’ve been on here, each with thousands of notes, and I’m now here to ask if you could show some love for Khaled; Khaled has been dating my best friend for over a year, and he’s in a tricky situation right now. Any donation, no matter how seemingly small, is going to go a long way towards helping his family out. 

Khaled’s Story

Khaled is a bright, funny and compassionate twenty-year-old, who, until recently, was in his first year studying an undergraduate’s degree in Business at Wolverhampton University. He has a loving family and girlfriend, and enjoys playing football with his friends.

He also has Hodgkins Lymphoma- an agressive and complex form of cancer that affects, on average, 1 in 360 men at some point in their lifetimes.

Khaled received his cancer diagnosis after visiting his doctor multiple times complaining of what he believed to be reoccuring tonsillitis. Within a week, he was scheduled to have his first round of chemotherapy. Always upbeat, Khaled is now a popular patient at the cancer clinic, is always joking with the nurses and never stops smiling, despite, quite understandably, being concerned about what the next few years will hold.

What will your money do for Khaled?

With the main breadwinner being made redundant recently, Khaled’s family of six has, until this point, been living off Khaled and his older brother’s student loans. Khaled has had to drop out of university and, therefore, is no longer entitled to student loan, cutting the family’s income by half.

Any donation you can make will help pay for basic necessities like groceries, taxi fares to help get Khaled to and from his chemo appointments, and help his family keep on top of household bills. All contributions will be gratefully received, no matter how small, and will go a long way to help make an already stressful situation easier by providing Khaled the peace of mind that his family are provided for, meaning he can concentrate on his recovery.

summary:
Try this energizing breath adapted from yogic breathing techniques.

When done properly, the stimulating breath can be...
caption:
Try this energizing breath adapted from yogic breathing techniques.

When done properly, the stimulating breath can be invigorating. This is a diaphragmatic breathing exercise to give you a boost.

Begin by inhaling and exhaling rapidly through your nose in equal durations. As you quicken the pace work up to three in-and-out breathe cycles per second to create a quick movement in the diaphragm. Be careful not to go beyond 15 seconds when you first begin this technique.

Are you looking for strategies to help you optimise your health? If so, I’d like to invite you to sign up for Your Health Matters over on https://lotuspowerhealth.com.


#health #womenshealth #wellness #womenswellness #wellnesswisdom #wellnesswisdomforwomen #endometriosis #pcos #fibroids #infertility #menstrualpain #takecontrolofyourhealth #yourhealthmatters #essentialoils

summary: 5 Reasons Why the North Carolina Tar Heels Will Win it All in 2019 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: 5 Reasons Why the North Carolina Tar Heels Will Win it All in 2019 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
March Madness is finally upon us. And the North Carolina Tar Heels are all set to embark on their quest for a seventh national championship when they take on the Iona Gaels in Columbus, Ohio, on Friday in the first round of the 2019 NCAA Tournament. North Carolina will do so as a No. 1 seed for a record 17th time on the strength of an impressive 27-6 campaign that includes a share of the ACC regular-season crown.
Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: Life gets better when you Quit Smoking [Infographic] | ecogreenlove → http://ecogreenlove.com/?p=9742 It’s well known that...
caption:
Life gets better when you Quit Smoking [Infographic] | ecogreenlove

→ http://ecogreenlove.com/?p=9742

It’s well known that smoking is a direct cause of cancer, with the tar and nicotine found in cigarettes vastly increasing the chances of contracting the deadly disease at some point in a person’s life. But what other reasons are there to quit smoking altogether?

Whether you’re looking to ensure you always have the freshest breath when you go in for a smooch, or you want to keep your fingers and teeth stain-free, find out how giving up this vice will make a massive difference.

#health #heartdisease #vice

blog.name: fitness-journey-of-a-fat-girl
blog.title: Everyday Is A New Day
blog.description: I’m a 23 year old college student who has struggled with weight my whole life. Recently my mother was diagnosed with diabetes and I had my own “pre-diabetic” scare. I was also diagnosed with PCOS and some mental illness. I’ve been eating the recommended diabetic carb intake since 9/12/18. I have also been a vegetarian for seven years now and I’m allergic to gluten. I have a long way to go and wanted to keep a blog of my journey! Even if I’m the only one reading this I want to be able to look back on my progress. However, I hope you come along for the ride and get something out of this! :)

summary: I had just posted my progress photos on my social media last night. Now, I feel like I’m a fool and that I’m going to gain back...
body: I had just posted my progress photos on my social media last night. Now, I feel like I’m a fool and that I’m going to gain back all my weight and people are going to notice and laugh. I feel like I’m disappointing all of you. I feel low.

reblog.comment: I had just posted my progress photos on my social media last night. Now, I feel like I’m a fool and that I’m going to gain back all my weight and people are going to notice and laugh. I feel like I’m disappointing all of you. I feel low.

trail.content_raw: I had just posted my progress photos on my social media last night. Now, I feel like I’m a fool and that I’m going to gain back all my weight and people are going to notice and laugh. I feel like I’m disappointing all of you. I feel low.

summary: March Madness NCAA Tournament Games on TV Today (Wednesday, March 20) https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: March Madness NCAA Tournament Games on TV Today (Wednesday, March 20) https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The field of 64 for the 2019 NCAA Tournament will be set when the First Four wraps up with two more games on Wednesday, March 20. Four more teams will play in Dayton, Ohio, with the winners moving on to first round matchups on Friday.

Wednesday will see a pair of No. 16 seeds face off for the right to take on No. 1 overall seed Duke in Columbia, South Carolina. The nightcap has two of the final four at-large selections going head-to-head with the winner advancing on to play No. 6 seed Buffalo in West Region play in Tulsa.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: At what age does your body peak? via /r/Fitness
title: At what age does your body peak? via /r/Fitness
body:
I’m 28 years old about to turn 29 and I just started lifting weights and working out hard maybe 2 years ago. I’ve always had a very sedentary lifestyle however within the past two years I’ve discovered that I love lifting weights and boxing. I work out 6 times a week now and rest on Sundays. I’ve gone from 260 pounds to about 215 pounds in the past two years.

Now that working out has become a lifestyle i want to perfect it and become even better at everything. My only question for all of you people who been working out for years is will me starting to workout so late in life effect my “gains”? Will it cause me to not be able to have the right aesthetics or peak performance?



Submitted March 20, 2019 at 06:20AM by joshrey789
via reddit https://ift.tt/2HKCPaj

summary:
Your Dangerous Cholesterol is Coming From Carbs, Not Fat    
In this video, Dr. Berg talks about the dangerous cholesterol that...
caption:
Your Dangerous Cholesterol is Coming From Carbs, Not Fat


In this video, Dr. Berg talks about the dangerous cholesterol that is in your arteries that is not coming from the dietary fat. De Novo Lipogenesis which means the creation of new lipids from carbohydrates.

blog.name: fitness-journey-of-a-fat-girl
blog.title: Everyday Is A New Day
blog.description: I’m a 23 year old college student who has struggled with weight my whole life. Recently my mother was diagnosed with diabetes and I had my own “pre-diabetic” scare. I was also diagnosed with PCOS and some mental illness. I’ve been eating the recommended diabetic carb intake since 9/12/18. I have also been a vegetarian for seven years now and I’m allergic to gluten. I have a long way to go and wanted to keep a blog of my journey! Even if I’m the only one reading this I want to be able to look back on my progress. However, I hope you come along for the ride and get something out of this! :)

body:
Weigh In - Week 17

SW - 267.8 - 9/12/18

CW - 231.4 - 3/20/19

Loss this week - +1.4

Loss total - 36.4


I’m really upset. I’m not sure what I did. I do currently have my period. I also fucked up a few times this week but I didn’t think I fucked up that bad =. It’s going to take me weeks to lose this gain. Frustrated.
